column4: Hi guys! To test 8.10, I installed it alongside 8.04 and when I was certain it worked, I upgraded 8.04 to 8.10. The problem is that the upgraded one can't display properly. So can I export some settings from the working 8.10 onto the non-working one?
Yes, but I have many other settings, you know....
When I boot, it tells me it cannot configure the display so do I want to reconfigure it myself? When I say "yes" nothing happens....
Check your menu.lst in grub to see if you're using the latest kernel.
I told it to keep my old kernel and well, Nvidia hated it.
[17:18] <Yuji1> Check your menu.lst in grub to see if you're using the latest kernel. ==> Is this for me?
So update to the latest kernel, make sure your menu.lst is updated to it, log on (it may ask to configure graphics, continue in low graphics) install latest nvidia, done. Shutdown restart.
Thats how I got it to work.
Not tried yet, but that's already something to try! :)
